title: JEE main cutoff
content:
Hey, do yall have any idea what the cutoff usually is for CSE RR through jee mains? I’m expecting ~98.5 percentile 


Also, what’s the procedure in that case? Is there separate counseling or will I simply be informed over mail about the admission

comments.body: If u got 98.5 in jee why tf r u considering PES
Just as a backup, in case I don’t get a better college through other exams. Plus 98.5 isn’t enough for any good iiit or nit cs
Go with private colleges with smaller batch sizes , plenty of those which accept JEE scores , placements are shit for 24 batch 40% students are still unplaced in CSE.
buddy just try with other attempt and do something why pes having 98.5 %ile

>40% students are still unplaced in CSE.

RR  and EC combined?.

But this is all India trend though even IITs and IIMs are suffering.
because PES >>

are you aware of the job market situation rn? 
yea the batch size is a problem but the bigger problem is the job market

Okay so  


98.5 percentile should get you CS in RR Campus  
I got 98.85 percentile and I did get CS in RR Campus with that score

When I gave JEE in 2022 and applied for PES through Mains , here's what the procedure was (as far as I remember)  
There is a separate portal for applying through Mains , and you apply there with your Mains  NTA Score Card. As far as I know there is no counselling process like rounds as such , you receive an email if you get the admission.  
(This might have changed over the course of 2 years , so please verify it once )  


The important thing is , if you applied through PESSAT as well , please don't pay through your PESSAT seat first  
So what happened to me was  
I had applied through Mains and PESSAT , and through PESSAT there was physical counselling .  So I attended the physical counselling where I was allotted AIML at RR Campus . I had to pay the fees on spot to block this available seat and be considered for further rounds of counselling . About 4.5L. The previous night at 2 AM , I had got a mail saying I got admission to PES CS at RR Campus and that " I need not take part in PESSAT counselling now ". To my bad luck I read this mail after the physical counselling. But we weren't too worried , we thought we would sort it out with the management , saying I got AIML through PESSAT and CS through Mains ( both RR Campus) and we paid the fees for AIML , please switch our seat to CS. But nope , not only did the management disagree to our request ( we were not asking for a free seat , it was just a basic switch between two seats which I earned ) , but they treated us really badly , and the Admissions manager shouted at us for not reading the mail . Like they send the mail in the middle of the night and expected us to read it and come.   
I hated the experience with PES , and decided to forgo both my seats at PES.   


Today , I'm in second year in a different college  


Good luck with your counselling process.
if you're expecting to get 98.5 percentile then you could easily get into better colleges such as DTU, NSUT, IIIT-B, Thapar etc
Yeah greater than nothing
Ull get bits bro if u have 98.5 in jee. Just take any stream over there trust me
Is it any different in other tier 2 colleges

98.5 is a really good percentile, don't come to pes with that score , u will get much better options elsewhere like iiit bangalore ece[ avg 25 lakhs per annum]
Consider pes only if score is below 97.5 and your not getting decent branch in bits , iiits, mid nits, dtu , nsut, jadavpur etc
Just check with people in IITs before making a decision because I'm pretty sure they're getting placed and CS peeps in most IITs have PPOs ,they don't even sit for placements.
Nah IITs have been hit. CS people may still get through. But overall IITs have been hit especially newer ones .

Yeah the batch size is ginormous so odds of getting placed are good if your CGPA is more than 8.5 other than that there is a lot of internal competition for everything and people outside Bangalore barely know PES , I'd say go with Thapar , Lmnit , RVCE etc.
Yeah intake is always an issue here

iit blr cutoff is 10k rank in mains thats like 99.1 minimum in 2023

this year with about 15-16L writing you'll need 99.4 minimum

Lmao this^
Honestly
daim which college r u rn in?
I'm not sure what the exact cutoff is, but I got CSE in RR with 98.26 last year
U can get cs in lnmit,daict and thapar
U need 99.5+ if u want cse in DTU,NSUT and IITB...Thapar,LNMIT,DAICT are possible tho
How is lnmiit, someone told that it will get ruined in coming years due to financial issues
you can get mechanical in one of the top 10 NITs with that percentile

the fact that you were spot on correct with the percentile 

  
respect
